meanings.definition: The quality or state of being incommunicable.
meanings.sent1: The incommunicability of his emotions made it hard for him to express his feelings.
meanings.sent2: The incommunicability of her thoughts left her feeling isolated.
meanings.sent3: The incommunicability of the secret recipe led to much speculation among the family members.
meanings.sent4: The incommunicability of the ancient language added an air of mystery to the archaeological discovery.
meanings.sent5: The incommunicability of the concept was like trying to grasp a shadow in the dark.

meanings.definition: The inability to be communicated or shared.
meanings.sent1: The incommunicability of his pain made it difficult for others to understand his suffering.
meanings.sent2: The incommunicability of her joy was evident in her radiant smile.
meanings.sent3: The incommunicability of the wifi password caused frustration among the guests.
meanings.sent4: The incommunicability of his fear was like a heavy weight on his chest.
meanings.sent5: The incommunicability of the news spread like wildfire through the small town.
